title: What to expect from Rory and Scottie, and how will Royal Portrush play?
content: Is Scottie Scheffler the overwhelming favorite? Is Rory McIlroy's game rounding into form? We look at five storylines to watch this week at the Open Championship.

title: Source: Vet Miller to Commanders on 1-year deal
content: The Commanders are signing veteran defensive end Von Miller, a move designed to bolster their pass rush and increase their ability to close out games on defense.

title: Former Texans, Eagles LB Braman dies at 38
content: Former Texans and Eagles linebacker Bryan Braman has died after seeking treatment this year for a rare, aggressive form of cancer, according to his agent. He was 38.

title: Mickelson cards his best Open start since 2016
content: Phil Mickelson avoided most of the rain to card a 1-under 70 for his best opening round at an Open Championship since 2016.

title: Sources: 49ers' Collins third Round 2 pick in fold
content: The 49ers' agreement with DT Alfred Collins is worth $10.3 million over four years and includes $9M guaranteed, sources told ESPN. He becomes just the third second-round pick this year to have signed with his team (Carson Schwesinger, Jayden Higgins).

title: Miami 'outclassed' as historic Messi streak ends
content: Lionel Messi's MLS record streak of scoring two goals in a game ended at five as Inter Miami CF lost 3-0 to FC Cincinnati on Wednesday night.

title: Biles, SGA, Eagles capture top honors at ESPYS
content: Olympic champion gymnast Simone Biles and NBA Finals MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander took home top athlete honors, while the Super Bowl champion Eagles won best team at The ESPYS.

title: D-backs star Marte's home robbed during break
content: Police are investigating a burglary that is believed to have happened Tuesday night at a home owned by Diamondbacks star Ketel Marte.

title: Arsenal signs Smith in record for women's soccer
content: Arsenal have confirmed the signing of Olivia Smith, with sources telling ESPN that it is a world record fee and the first £1 million transfer in women's football.

title: 📷 Stars shine on the ESPYS red carpet
content: The stars shined on the red carpet before heading into the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles for the 33rd annual ESPYS.

title: The 10 MLB trends that ruled the first half -- and whether they'll continue
content: From chaos in the AL East to emerging young sluggers, we break down the season's biggest themes and what we should expect down the stretch run.

title: The top 10 cornerbacks ahead of 2025 NFL season: Who is ranked after Pat Surtain II?
content: Who are the best cornerbacks in the NFL? We asked execs, coaches and scouts from around the league to rank their top 10.

title: Who will be the No. 1 pick in the 2026 NFL draft? We predicted chances for 14 top prospects
content: Which quarterback could go first overall? What about edge rusher T.J. Parker or another non-QB? Let's project the race.

title: How Bradley Beal and the Suns finalized their contentious divorce
content: Throughout the February trade deadline to the draft to free agency, one element of the Suns' roster-building failure has loomed for the Suns: how to end their marriage to the three-time All-Star.

title: Updated top 10 prospect rankings for all 30 MLB teams -- with 2025 draft picks included!
content: Who is rising and falling in every major league farm system after the MLB draft? Kiley McDaniel digs in.

title: 'Sad.' 'Embarrassing.' Why players were a no-show at the MLB draft
content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

title: How Bo Jackson on a bicycle united Alabama after a record-breaking storm
content: The GOAT created a bike ride to help tornado-damaged Alabama. No one knew what it'd do -- or how it'd end.

title: Ranking the top 25 college football recruits regardless of class
content: Why let rising seniors get all the glory? We break down the best prospects in the country, including underclassmen.

title: Weah to Marseille, Reyna to anywhere but Dortmund? Best transfer fits for USMNT stars
content: The World Cup is just one year away, so what moves, if any, should these eight USMNT players make to ensure they'll be in top form next summer?

title: Sources: Liverpool advancing in talks over Ekitike
content: Liverpool are progressing in talks to sign striker Hugo Ekitike from Eintracht Frankfurt, sources told ESPN.

title: Neymar scores in 1st full match in five months
content: Santos forward Neymar scored his first league goal of the season against league leaders Flamengo on Wednesday and proclaimed the triumph as "a new beginning."

title: Sources: Wolves agree to sign CWC star Arias
content: Wolves have reached an agreement with Brazilian side Fluminense to sign Colombia winger Jhon Arias, sources have told ESPN.

title: Yamal given Messi's iconic Barça No. 10 jersey
content: Lamine Yamal has been handed the iconic Barcelona No. 10 shirt previously worn by Lionel Messi, the Catalan club confirmed Wednesday.

title: Freese 'devastated' but hungry after Mexico loss
content: USMNT goalkeeper Matt Freese said he felt devastated following the Gold Cup final loss to Mexico, but insists it will be motivation for the World Cup.

title: Bradley: What it's like boxing Pacquiao, and how he can beat Barrios
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts about fighting Manny Pacquiao and breaks down Saturday's fight.

title: Passan: Inside the first swing-off in MLB All-Star Game history
content: On a night full of firsts, none resonated as much as the finale -- and Kyle Schwarber's titanic performance.

title: Ward, McMillan and others primed to follow path of 2024 breakouts
content: These players are in position to follow a similar path to last year's breakouts and produce big numbers.

title: Year 2 player spotlight: Maye, Harrison, Odunze among popular breakouts
content: The ESPN Fantasy staff lists NFL sophomores who are undervalued in drafts and others who are under scrutiny.

title: Should we have been surprised? A look back at the season's first-half predictions
content: How good is our crystal ball? Before the season's second half gets underway, let's see how our first-half predictions panned out.

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire.

title: Top Georgia high school hoopers since 2000 : Who earned the crown?
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of Georgia based on high school career achievements.

title: Girelli shows Norway how to be clinical as Italy reach Euro 2025 semifinal
content: Italy are in their first Euro semifinal since 1997 as Cristiana Girelli netted a brace and Norway's Ada Hegerberg struggled.

title: Revitalized Sweden pose serious threat to England
content: Three years ago when the teams met, the score was one-sided. This Swedish team is a different proposition, though.

title: Fugitive in 2020 twin murder case arrested from Bengaluru
content: He was wanted in connection with the murder of Mohammed Sali and his wife Sheeba Sali near Kottayam. Though arrested earlier, he absconded during the trial

title: Stolen 150-year-old kalash from Ahmedabad’s Sarkhej Roza recovered, four held
content: The artefact was installed on the dome of the mausoleum of Sheikh Ahmad Khattu Ganj Bakhsh — the spiritual mentor of Sultan Ahmad Shah, founder of Ahmedabad

title: From exile to home: Tribal families reclaim roots in Gujarat village after a decade
content: The event was marked by symbolic rituals, heartfelt gestures of reconciliation, and a firm governmental commitment to integrate members of the Kodarvi community back into the mainstream with dignity and support

title: Legal action from September against land encroachers in Idukki
content: Large-scale land grab was reported on the Parunthumpara hills. A special team of the Revenue department is conducting document verification in the area

title: Kerala HC orders interim stay on proceedings against CM in Ernakulam CJM court
content: On Ernakulam DCC president’s plea against Pinarayi Vijayan for “abetting violence” during Nava Kerala Yatra

title: Kerala govt. issues guidelines for departments to procure land for public purposes
content: Guidelines are meant to simplify procedures for the acquisition and disposal of land so as to avoid time and cost overruns in project completion and to minimise litigation over compensation

title: Now, Kannada mobile app for SSLC students
content: It is being launched considering the decreasing passing percentage in SSLC examination particularly among Kannada medium students

title: Telangana: State-level review meeting held to improve prisoner escort mechanism
content: The ADGP issued a series of key directives aimed at boosting operational efficiency, inter-departmental coordination, and legal compliance in handling prisoner escorts

title: Custody row: Supreme Court directs Centre to issue LOC against Russian wife, child on Indian man's plea
content: The father is fighting a custody battle for the child with the estranged Russian wife and alleged she wasn't complying with the court's order of custody of the minor

title: AAIB urges public, media to avoid ‘premature narratives’ on Air India plane crash
content: The Aircraft Accident Investigation says that the final report will bring out root causes and recommendations and therefore everyone must wait for the investigation to conclude

title: Officer humiliated by Siddaramaiah during Belagavi conference now posted as DCP
content: Narayan Baramani earlier sought voluntary retirement from service saying he could not tolerate the public humiliation by the Chief Minister

title: Officials told to collect trade licence arrears
content: The Commissioner also directed the officials to ensure quality and tasty food is served at the five Anna Canteens in the Corporation limits

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG's Donnarumma wanted by Man City, Bayern Munich
content: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma is a target for Man City and Bayern Munich. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Where do Taylor and Serrano land after all-women card?
content: Lots of movement after a boxing card with 17 titles on the line. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Kochi adjudged cleanest city in Kerala in national survey
content: In the ninth edition of Swachh Survekshan survey 2024, Kochi improves its position to 50th from the previous 416th

title: Tiruchi Corporation to take up 21 projects under Namakku Naame scheme
content: The projects, taken up across different wards in the city, fall under various categories, including road improvement, installation of water pipes, sewage network and construction of civic amenities

title: Air India crash: Report claims state of ‘confusion’ between pilots, says former DGCA flight operations inspector
content: Captain Prashant Dhalla explained that this report suggests a challenge-and-response dynamic exists between the two pilots, with one questioning the other, and a state of confusion

title: B.R. Patil wants Siddaramaiah to lead campaign for MSP legal guarantee
content: The Aland MLA, who is also the Deputy Chairman of KSPPC, has urged the Chief Minister to lead the campaign at the national level

title: Scrub typhus is now the most common infectious cause of acute encephalitis syndrome in southern India
content: In India, over 10,000 cases of AES are reported annually to the National Vector Borne Disease Control Programme

title: Women farmers protest eviction from Rythu Bazaar
content: Marketing department officials recently issued notices to farmers, asking them to vacate the premises without mentioning the reason for the decision

title: Committing assault, theft in U.S. could lead to visa being revoked: U.S. Embassy in India
content: The stern warning comes in the backdrop of a viral video purportedly showing an Indian woman being held by police authorities after she allegedly tried to shoplift several items at a high-end store in the U.S.

title: Supreme Court stays High Court order impleading H.D. Kumaraswamy in contempt case
content: The case is related to allegations of large-scale encroachment of land by the Union Minister and his family

title: Student’s death at private college near Nagapattinam sparks protest
content: Final-year physiotherapy student died by suicide on the campus premises two days ago; family, students staged road blockade demanding inquiry

title: Ensure safe environment for women employees, girl students in all schools: Odisha Government to DEOs
content: Odisha Government mandates safe environment for women employees and students in schools and also instructs implementation of a gender gender equity program to prevent gender-based violence

title: Farmers organisations early completion of construction of regulator across the Vettar
content: The ₹49.5-crore regulator project being executed by the Water Resources Department at Uthamachozhapuram aims at preventing seawater intrusion into the river

title: IIST team discovers radio emission with circular polarisation near a massive young protostar
content: Discovery linked to IRAS 18162-2048, a massive protostar in the Milky Way, expands scientists’ understanding of how massive stars form, say a research team from Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology, Thiruvananthapuram

title: Nimisha Priya case: In touch with local authorities in Yemen to resolve issue, says External Affairs Ministry
content: "This is a sensitive matter and the government of India has been offering all possible assistance in the case," External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said

title: Bomb threats to Mumbai-Ahmedabad flight, international airport: Navi Mumbai cops register FIR
content: The mobile phone numbers from which the calls were made have been identified and further probe is underway through these leads

title: ‘Janaki V Vs State of Kerala’ movie review: Suresh Gopi-Anupama Parameswaran film is insensitive and pointless
content: The Suresh Gopi starrer, ‘Janaki V Vs State of Kerala, is caught between the need to tell a sensitive story and projecting the superhero aura of its lead actor, who plays an advocate

title: Grief strikes Kollam family as Class VIII student electrocuted at school
content: Midhun, a resident of Valiyapadam East Ward of West Kallada grama panchayat, was engaged in a game with his friends when his footwear fell on the roof of a shed. He was electrocuted while trying to retrieve it

title: Annamalai reiterates Amit Shah’s stand on coalition government in T.N. if NDA wins 2026 Assembly polls
content: Mr. Annamalai said the alliance was conceived by the Union Home Minister himself and that he had no role in reviving the ties between the AIADMK and BJP

title: Renukaswamy murder case: Supreme Court raps Karnataka High Court for granting bail to actor Darshan
content: The Bench asked senior advocate Kapil Sibal, appearing for the actor, to give “good reasons” why it should not interfere with bail order

title: ‘Wall Street Journal seems to know more than any of us in India’: Aviation expert questions leak of AI171 crash details
content: Mr. Lazar said there should be a judicial probe into the Air India AI171 crash to ensure full transparency and accountability

title: INDIA bloc to meet in Delhi on July 19: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav
content: Opposition leaders are expected to deliberate key issues to be raised during the forthcoming Monsoon Session of Parliament

title: Avoid unnecessary debate on late Congress leader Kamaraj: T.N. CM Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin said he was fortunate to have received Kamaraj’s blessings at his wedding. “Despite his ill health, he attended my marriage,” the DMK president added.

title: House in Kasaragod damaged after massive rock falls on it, family escapes unhurt
content: Family alleges that despite written complaint on the potential danger posed by loose rocks, the authorities have failed to take action

title: AKG Museum getting ready at Peralassery in Kannur promises immersive experience into a revolutionary’s life
content: The museum promises a multi-dimensional experience of A.K Gopalan’s life, struggles, and political journey. With a total outlay of ₹25 crore, the initiative is being implemented in multiple phases

title: In a rare move, Supreme Court reviews judgment to comfort ‘anxious’ child in custody case
content: In an open court hearing, which is itself a rare occurrence, the Bench headed by Justice Vikram Nath concluded its judgment in the custody case had a ‘calamitous effect’ on the mental health of the boy

title: Madras High Court attempts to find solution for rental dispute between Tambaram Police Commissionerate and its landlords
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh asks Advocate General P.S. Raman and the counsel for the landlords to file a calculation memo for an enhanced monthly rent

title: Over 5.76 lakh Bihar electors are enrolled at multiple places: EC data
content: Official data states that out of nearly 7.90 crore electors, over 35.69 lakh were not found at their addresses during the house-to-house visit of booth-level officers

title: ED raid on promoters of Shushruti Souhardha Bank in Bengaluru
content: ED claims to have unearthed more than 20 high-value properties not identified by authorities of the State government earlier

title: Heavy rainfall alert in seven TG districts on July 18
content: Thunderstorms accompanied with lightning and strong surface winds are very likely at isolated places in all 33 districts

title: Madras HC Chief Justice constitutes larger Bench to hear dispute over removal of flagpoles from public places
content: Communist Party of India (Marxist) State secretary P. Shanmugam had contended that it was the democratic right of political parties to display their flags

title: Man rapes 10-year-old girl returning from school near Gummidipoondi; special teams on lookout for accused
content: Efforts are under way to trace the suspect, who may have crossed over to Andhra Pradesh; special teams have been deployed for the search

title: From canteen boy to author: Malayali writer Jalal Rahman’s book now in Arabic
content: Forced to quit school at age of 12 to support his family, Jalal Rahman, now based in Saudi Arabia, has released Dikrayath Jalal Rahman Al Khaleejil Arabi, the Arabic translation of his second book Angum Ingum Engum

title: 'Selective & unverified': AAIB slams foreign media coverage of AI crash probe; calls it 'irresponsible'
content: The Air India crash investigator has criticized international media outlets for their "selective and unverified" reporting on the recent Air India crash. This rebuke follows a report by the Wall Street Journal suggesting the pilot cut fuel flow to the engines.

title: India slams Nato chief's warning on trade with Russia; flags 'double standards'
content: External affairs ministry has cautioned against double standards following NATO chief Rutte's warning of potential secondary sanctions for countries, including India, maintaining trade ties with Russia. Rutte urged India, China, and Brazil to reconsider their economic relations with Moscow or face sanctions if Russia doesn't engage in peace talks.

title: BJP-UBT reunion? Uddhav meets Fadnavis day after CM's 'invite' to rejoin Mahayuti
content: Amidst political shifts in Maharashtra, Devendra Fadnavis has extended an invitation to Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena UBT to rejoin the ruling coalition. This comes after Thackeray met with Chief Minister Shinde, sparking speculation about a potential reconciliation. Fadnavis emphasized the BJP's stability until 2029, suggesting an opportunity for Thackeray to reconsider alliances.

title: IND vs ENG: Jasprit Bumrah available for 4th Test? Check details
content: Team India's assistant coach, Ryan ten Doeschate, revealed that Jasprit Bumrah's availability for the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford will be decided in Manchester. The decision hinges on factors like weather conditions, the team's best chance of winning, and a holistic view of the last two games in the series, considering Bumrah's preferred shorter spells.

title: Intel layoffs: Company job cuts cross 5,000 in July; numbers rise 4x in…
content: Global semiconductor giant Intel is implementing a significant restructuring plan, resulting in over 5,000 layoffs across US locations including California, Oregon, Arizona and Texas. The job cuts, impacting engineers, senior leaders, and back-office staff, aim to streamline operations and address financial losses. This follows 15,000 job cuts earlier in 2024, bringing the total to over 20,000.

title: How Epstein files broke Trump's love affair with MAGA
content: On Truth Social, Trump lashed out at his own supporters, calling those demanding transparency over Epstein’s files “weaklings” who had “bought into this b*******, hook, line, and sinker.” The insult stunned many longtime allies. Even the usually sycophantic Trump War Room refused to repost the outburst, a silent sign of discomfort within the inner sanctum. What was once a unified political religion now resembles a schismatic cult.

title: IND vs ENG: Big update on Pant’s injury! Team India may have to take tough call
content: Team India's assistant coach, Ryan ten Doeschate, has confirmed that Rishabh Pant is nearing full fitness before the fourth Test against England. Despite a finger injury sustained during the Lord's Test, Pant batted with pain and scored a valuable 74. The decision on whether he will keep wickets in Manchester is yet to be made, prioritizing his complete recovery.

title: When Microsoft founder Bill Gates said he couldn't start his day without playing this mobile game
content: Microsoft founder Bill Gates is an avid Wordle player. He starts his day solving the word puzzle. Gates also enjoys Quordle, Octordle, and Nerdle. He uses vowel-heavy words as starting guesses. Gates compares scores with friends and family. He believes reading habits give him an advantage. Gates finds puzzles with multiple potential answers hardest.

title: IND vs ENG: Injury blow to India? Indian pacer sports tape on bowling hand
content: Team India faces mounting challenges ahead of the crucial fourth Test against England in Manchester. Arshdeep Singh's hand injury during practice adds to existing concerns, including uncertainty around Jasprit Bumrah's availability and Rishabh Pant's finger injury. England also suffer a blow with Shoaib Bashir ruled out due to a finger fracture.

title: Nimisha Priya death row: Consular access provided; MEA says in touch with friendly nations
content: Nimisha Priya, a nurse from Kerala, faced a death sentence in Yemen. The execution, initially set for July 16, 2025, has been postponed. The Indian government is providing assistance to her family. They are exploring a blood money settlement under Yemeni law. Officials are in contact with local authorities and friendly governments.

title: NCERT calls Babur brutal: What history’s shifting lens reveals about the Mughal emperor
content: NCERT’s new Class 8 textbook calls Babur “brutal and ruthless,” sparking debates among students and scholars. But history’s view of the Mughal emperor has always been a shifting kaleidoscope—from Baburnama’s poetic warlord to British colonial critiques, and modern takes by Dalrymple and Maldahiyar. This article dives into centuries of contrasting portrayals and asks: Are students ready to meet Babur not as a hero or villain—but as both?

title: Inside tech billionaire diets: Musk eats Mars Bars; Zuckerberg eats everything
content: Tech titans like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg have unique eating habits, from quick meals and sweet cravings to carnivore experiments. Jeff Bezos enjoys mindful mornings with exotic dishes, while Jack Dorsey practices extreme dietary restrictions. Bill Gates favours fast food, Richard Branson loves tea, and Steve Jobs followed spiritual fasting, reflecting their diverse approaches to food and health.

title: Shocking! Pakistan's Nadeem hits out at false promises: 'Every plot announcement was ...'
content: Pakistani Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem, who won gold at the Paris Games, has voiced concerns over unfulfilled promises of land plots made after his victory. Despite receiving cash prizes, the plot announcements remain unfulfilled. Nadeem recently underwent successful muscle surgery in the UK for a calf injury and is preparing for the World Championships.

title: Lalu Yadav moves SC: Dismissal of proceedings sought in land-for-Job case; hearing on July 18
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav has approached the Supreme Court. This action follows the Delhi High Court's rejection of his request. He sought a stay on proceedings in the land-for-job case. The case involves alleged appointments made during his tenure as railway minister. He claims the FIR was delayed. He also alleges political motivation behind the investigation.

title: Bryan Braman dies: Former Eagles LB & Super Bowl champion loses cancer battle
content: The NFL community mourns the loss of Bryan Braman, the former Philadelphia Eagles linebacker and Super Bowl champion, who passed away at 38 after a private battle with cancer. Known for his relentless special teams play and unwavering loyalty, Braman's journey from an undrafted player to a key member of the Eagles' Super Bowl LII-winning team inspired many.

title: Gunmen walk into ICU, open fire, flee: Murder convict shot dead in Patna hospital
content: A shocking shooting occurred at Patna's Paras Hospital. CCTV footage shows assailants killing a murder convict. The incident triggered strong political reactions. Opposition parties criticize Nitish Kumar's government. They allege a breakdown of law and order in Bihar. Leaders demand investigation and accountability. Another murder reported in Shahpur locality. Concerns rise over increasing crime rates in the state.

title: Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce support dad Scott Swift after heart surgery
content: Taylor Swift prioritized her family as her father, Scott Swift, underwent a quintuple bypass surgery last month. She paused her Eras Tour obligations to be with him, along with her mother, Andrea, and brother, Austin. Travis Kelce, her boyfriend, offered his support during this challenging time, as the family focused on Scott's recovery following the procedure.

title: Luka Doncic might walk from the Los Angeles Lakers. Here's why
content: Luka Doncic's future with the Los Angeles Lakers is uncertain as he approaches a player option in 2025-26. Tension arises from the Lakers' apparent shift towards prioritizing Doncic over LeBron James, potentially alienating the Slovenian star. Concerns grow that the Lakers' treatment of James could impact Doncic's trust and willingness to commit long-term.

title: Shaquille O’Neal threatens to punch Robert Griffin III over Angel Reese
content: NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal has issued a stern warning to former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III over his negative comments and a racist social media post targeting WNBA player Angel Reese. O'Neal, angered by Griffin's actions, particularly the reposting of a derogatory image, threatened physical violence if Griffin continues his behavior.

title: Starstruck! 14-yo Suryavanshi lost in cricket's greatness; video goes viral
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old Indian cricketer, is making waves in England. He is part of the India U19 team. Suryavanshi played a key role in the Youth ODI series win. He also scored a half-century in the 1st Youth Test. The team visited Lord's, soaking in the history. Suryavanshi admired portraits of various cricket legends.

title: UIDAI plans simplifying offline Aadhaar for citizen KYC; safer, user-friendly process
content: The UIDAI is enhancing offline Aadhaar-based KYC to boost security and user-friendliness across financial services. This initiative aims to allow KYC completion without sharing Aadhaar numbers or personal details, promoting privacy. By promoting QR codes and PDFs, UIDAI simplifies the verification process and encourages compliant adoption among startups and financial providers.

title: Reverse switch slap or reverse switch pull? Batter plays a wild shot – Watch video
content: Middlesex batter Luke Hollman's innovative shot against Surrey, a blend of scoop and reverse switch hit, has taken social media by storm, sparking debate over its name. Despite Hollman's unbeaten 32 and earlier taking two crucial wickets, Middlesex fell short by eight runs in their chase of Surrey's 189.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Inspired by 2006 FIFA WC glory, Italy's cricket 'underdogs' take aim at T20 WC
content: Italy, known for their exploits in football and water polo, has qualified for the 2026 ICC Men's T20 World Cup. They defeated Netherlands in the Europe Region Final. Pacer Thomas Draca expressed his excitement at the prospect of playing in India and Sri Lanka in a year's time. He sees this as a beginning for cricket in Italy.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: BJP confident of coalition govt, says Annamalai amid EPS pushback
content: Amidst political maneuvering in Tamil Nadu, BJP leader Annamalai expressed confidence in forming a coalition government, suggesting AIADMK should address concerns with Amit Shah. This follows EPS's assertion that AIADMK will independently secure victory in 2026, contradicting Shah's vision of an NDA coalition.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Really bad': Broad slams Jaiswal's poor shot selection at Lord's
content: Stuart Broad criticized Yashasvi Jaiswal's poor shot selection in the second innings of the Lord's Test, stating it opened the door for England's victory. Broad highlighted that Jaiswal's aggressive style puts pressure on the opposition, but his dismissal allowed England to control the game and ultimately win by 22 runs, taking a 2-1 lead in the series.

title: Top ent news: Salman Khan on difficulty in action scenes, Renuka Shahane on language row
content: From Salman Khan powering through gruelling action scenes in freezing Ladakh for Battle of Galwan, to Kriti Sanon joining Don 3 after Kiara Advani’s exit, the headlines sizzle. Renuka Shahane speaks out on the Hindi-Marathi language row, Ram Kapoor supports Deepika’s 8-hour shift stance, and Priyanka-Nick’s beach PDA turns up the heat!

title: Bihar poll gambit: Nitish promises 125 free power units; opposition cries 'copycat'
content: Bihar's Chief Minister Nitish Kumar announced free electricity up to 125 units for domestic consumers starting August 2025, a move hailed by the NDA as historic. The opposition, however, criticized the announcement, accusing the government of copying their schemes and questioning the timing ahead of upcoming elections. The decision is expected to benefit 1.67 crore families in the state.

title: Tragic! 19-yo cyclist dies after fall during Tour of Aoste Valley-Mont Blanc - details inside
content: Italian cyclist Samuele Privitera, 19, tragically died after a fall during the Tour of the Aoste Valley-Mont Blanc. The accident occurred on Wednesday's first stage, with the cause still under investigation. Privitera, riding for Hagens Berman Jayco, was promptly assisted and taken to a hospital, but succumbed to his injuries.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-England cricketer takes a dig at Jadeja - 'He’s not...'
content: Moeen Ali has joined critics questioning Ravindra Jadeja's all-rounder role after India's loss at Lord's, despite praising his batting. Ali acknowledges Jadeja's tight bowling but notes a lack of wickets. He suggests including Kuldeep Yadav in the team, though fitting him in would be difficult. England currently leads the series 2-1.

title: 'No ties with Satyajit Ray': Bangladesh says house was 'dilapidated, unusable'
content: Bangladesh refuted India's claim regarding the demolition of Satyajit Ray's ancestral house in Mymensingh. They asserted that the structure being demolished has no connection to Ray's family, citing historical records and local testimonies. The land belongs to the government and was leased to Shishu Academy.

title: IND vs ENG: Nair vs Sai ? Former India player makes a blunt assessment
content: Former Indian cricketer Deep Dasgupta suggests replacing Karun Nair with B Sai Sudharsan for the remaining Test matches against England. Nair's struggles at number three, with only 131 runs and no half-century, prompt the call.

title: Trump tariff threat on Russia oil: India not worried about sanctions
content: India's Oil Minister Hardeep Singh Puri asserts the nation's readiness to handle potential disruptions in Russian oil imports, even with possible sanctions from the US and NATO. Alternative suppliers like Guyana, Brazil, and Canada are being explored.

title: Range Rover Velar launched in India at Rs 89.90 lakh: Details
content: Range Rover introduces the Velar Autobiography in India, priced at Rs 89.90 lakh. This flagship trim offers enhanced features and refinement, available in both petrol and diesel. It boasts copper accents, 20-inch alloy wheels, and Pixel LED headlamps. The interior includes Windsor leather seats, a panoramic sunroof, and a Meridian sound system.

title: Nasa to preview US-India radar mission: What is NISAR, when will it launch
content: NASA is set to reveal its collaborative Earth-observation mission with ISRO, named NISAR, which will provide a detailed three-dimensional view of our planet. Launching no earlier than late July, NISAR will employ dual-frequency radar to monitor Earth's dynamic surfaces, including ecosystems and natural hazards.

title: Another IndiGo scare: Imphal flight returns to Delhi mid-air; 2nd incident in 24 hrs
content: An IndiGo flight 6E-5118, en route from Delhi to Imphal on July 17, 2025, returned to Delhi shortly after takeoff due to a minor technical issue. The Airbus A321 aircraft landed safely, underwent checks, and resumed its journey. This incident occurred a day after another IndiGo flight experienced an engine failure and made an emergency landing in Mumbai.

title: ESPYS audience cheers for fake WNBA star Hicks before Gillis exposes truth
content: Shane Gillis hosted the 2025 ESPY Awards, opening with a prank involving a fake WNBA All-Star, "Brittany Hicks," fooling the audience. His monologue included jokes about Caitlin Clark and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, eliciting mixed reactions. The night honored major athletes, but Gillis's humor created an unpredictable atmosphere, dividing opinions between amusement and discomfort.

title: Carlsen falters! Neimann's hilarious reaction goes viral - Watch
content: Magnus Carlsen faced a shocking early exit at the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam Tour in Las Vegas, losing in a playoff to Levon Aronian. Hans Niemann, fresh off online qualification, celebrated Carlsen's defeat with an exuberant reaction that quickly went viral. The event also saw strong performances from Praggnanandhaa, Abdusattorov, and Sindarov, marking an unpredictable start to the tour.

title: Bihar’s crime surge: Top cop blames farmers, election heat
content: Bihar police attribute the recent crime surge to pre-monsoon patterns and election-related political attention, citing a traditional rise in murders before the rains. Additional Director General of Police, Kundan Krishnan, announced a new cell to monitor former shooters amidst opposition criticism of the Nitish Kumar government following several high-profile shootings, including a BJP leader and a businessman, intensifying political scrutiny.

title: Bengaluru: Which RCB posts have Karnataka govt cited in court against the franchise; stampede killed 11
content: The Karnataka government has held Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) responsible for a tragic stampede that resulted in 11 fatalities outside M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. Officials stated that RCB, along with DNA Networks and KSCA, organized victory celebrations without obtaining the necessary police permission.

title: US Deported 1,563 Indians Since Trump Became President Again, Centre Confirms
content: More than 15,000 Indian nationals have been deported to India from the United States after US President Donald Trump returned to the White House in January, the Foreign Minister said on Thursday.

title: Analysis | From Jest To Jolt: What Fadnavis' 'Offer' To Uddhav Really Means
content: While Fadnavis may have said it facetiously, the 'offer' to Uddhav Thackeray to join the government has been interpreted differently in Maharashtra's political landscape.

title: "There Hasn't Been One Moment...": Obamas Address Divorce Rumours
content: Barack Obama and Michelle Obama's marriage was "touch and go for a while," the former US President has said. But the former first lady said there was never a moment she thought about "quitting on my man".

title: Kerala Court Sentences Man To 3 Life Terms For Raping Minor Daughter For 3 Years
content: A Kerala court on Thursday sentenced a man to three life terms, till his death, for repeatedly sexually assaulting his minor daughter for three years, from the time she was five-years-old till she turned eight, at their rented accommodation near Kari

title: Tracked, Locked, Confirmed Kill: New Akash Missile Destroys Targets In Ladakh
content: At 15,000 feet in Ladakh, the Army achieved a significant milestone with the Akash surface-to-air missile. The new variant of the system - Akash Prime - scored two confirmed kills during a test run.

title: BJP vs AAP Over Arvind Kejriwal's "High-End" Mobile Phones
content: Delhi minister and BJP leader Ashish Sood has alleged that former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal and ex-deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia purchased multiple high-end mobile phones during their tenure, flouting government spending limits.

title: Uddhav Thackeray Meets Devendra Fadnavis Day After "Crossing Over" Joke
content: Allies-turned-adversaries Uddhav Thackeray and Devendra Fadnavis met today at the Maharashtra assembly - the facetime between the two coming after months.

title: Indian Couple's UK Assets Worth Rs 85 Crore Attached In Real Estate Scam
content: The Mumbai zonal office of the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached an immovable property in the UK belonging to Vinod Tanna and his wife in connection with a money laundering case linked to the Sai Group of companies.

title: UP BTech Student Hangs Self, Alleges Extortion By Girlfriend, Her Family In Video
content: A 20-year-old BTech student at a private university allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself in the courtyard of his home in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki district, police said on Thursday.

title: "As International Students Or...": Canada Sentences 2 Indians To Jail For Hit And Run Case, Face Deportation
content: Two international students from India have been sentenced to three years in prison and will possibly be deported after they serve the term after they killed an indigenous man last year in a hit and run case in Surrey, Canada.

title: Andhra Man Murders Live-In Partner, 24, For Refusing Prostitution
content: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her live-in partner here after she refused to engage in the sex trade, police said on Thursday.

title: Weak Calf Muscles May Be A Sign Of High Risk Of Dementia: Study
content: The strength of your calf muscles may help predict whether or not you will develop dementia, studies show. Strong calf muscles help maintain healthy blood pressure and ensure steady blood flow to the brain, both essential for cognitive performance.

title: Only 1 Of 3 Iranian Nuclear Sites Destroyed In US Strikes: Report
content: A new US assessment has found that American strikes in June destroyed only one of three Iranian nuclear sites, citing current and former US officials familiar with the matter.

title: Veteran Indian Diplomat Taranjit Sandhu Joins US-India Forum With Top Role
content: Ambassador Taranjit Singh Sandhu has been appointed Advisor to the Board of the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF) and Chairman of its newly established Geopolitical Institute.

title: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas's Big Advice To Entrepreneurs: "Sleep With Fear That..."
content: If you are a young entrepreneur with a big idea, expect that billion-dollar companies would try to steal it, said Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas.

title: Classroom Of Broken Promises: Collapse Of Public Education In Madhya Pradesh
content: In 2021, UNESCO released a damning report: Madhya Pradesh had the highest number of single-teacher schools in India -- 21,077. Three years later, that number has dropped to 12,210, according to the Centre.

title: Supreme Court's "Discretion" Remark After High Court Bail For Actor Darshan
content: Expressing its displeasure, the Supreme Court on Thursday said it felt the Karnataka High Court did not "exercise its discretion properly" while granting bail to actor Darshan Thoogudeepa in the case involving the murder of his fan Renukaswamy.

title: "Morale Of Criminals Sky-High": Chirag Paswan's Fresh Fire At Bihar Allies
content: Hours after five men walked into a Patna hospital and shot dead a criminal out on parole, Union Minister and NDA ally Chirag Paswan targeted the Nitish Kumar-led BJP-JDU government, saying Bihar's law and order situation has become cause for concern

title: Here's What Americans Think About Trump-Epstein Controversy
content: Most Americans think President Donald Trump's administration is hiding information about accused sex-trafficker Jeffrey Epstein and give it poor marks on the issue after pledging to make public documents in the case, a Reuters/Ipsos poll found.

title: On Patna Hospital's CCTV: 5 Men With Guns, A Murderer Shot Dead In Hospital
content: Five armed men entered a Bihar hospital, casually walked to a patient's room, pumped bullets into him, and escaped. No, this is not a movie scene. This is Bihar's horrifying reality.

title: The 20 most interesting storylines at NFL training camps

title: Joel Embiid sees you
content: Embiid was a media darling, both wry fabulist and helpless confessor . he spent two years rehabbing from surgeries to his right foot in the summers of 2014 and 2015 . his son, Arthur, is upstairs preparing for her birthday celebration .
